束.definition: to bind; bunch; bundle; classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc; to control

束之高閣.definition: tied up in a bundle on a high shelf; to put sth on the back burner; no longer a high priority

束手.definition: to have one's hands tied; helpless; unable to do anything about it

束手就擒.definition: lit. to submit to having one's hands tied and being taken prisoner (idiom); fig. to surrender without a fight

束手就斃.definition: hands tied and expecting the worst

束手待斃.definition: to wait helplessly for death (idiom); to resign oneself to extinction

束手待死.definition: hands tied and expecting the worst

束手無策.definition: lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis

束縛.definition: to bind; to tie up; to fetter; to shackle

束裝.definition: to bundle up (one's possessions for a journey)

束髮.definition: to tie up one's hair; (literary) (of a boy) to be in one's adolescence (in ancient China, boys tied up their hair)
